actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend Title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual's benefits shall not be reduced (under the earnings test) on account of earnings from self-employment unless such earnings are based on service perform after he or she become entitled to such benefits.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to disregard income, for the purposes of computing OASDI benefits based on income, received by an individual: (1) age 65 or older, from a copyright or patent obtained before he or she became 65; or (2) entitled to benefits, but who shows that the income is attributable to services performed before becoming entitled to benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend Title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual's benefits shall not be reduced (under the earnings test) on account of earnings from self-employment unless such earnings are based on service perform after he or she become entitled to such benefits.
